boat.construction_details: Larch planking on oak frames.  Mahogany coach roof.

for_sales.sales_text:
Albion is a project for someone.  The boat has been out of the water for the last 40 years, but work is ongoing with a fair portion of replacement planking (larch on an oak frame),  larch planking on deck and counterstern.   More recently the coach roof was added.

Albion has a full set of sails, a 20 HP Buck engine (working condition unknown), original winches and other items shown in the photographs.  The name was changed from Albion to Lively Lady which was changed back to Albion.

boat.full_description: The Albion is a 37 foot Oystersmack converted to a yacht in the 1930's.  The boat has not been at sea for 40 years requiring a refit.  A good portion of planking, deck and counterstern have been rebuilt in previous years an the coachroof recently reinstated.  Further substantial work is still required to make boat seaworthy.
boat.name: Albion
boat.short_description: A Harris built Smack, Albion is in need of a refit.
